snippet: A manual designed to help officers bridge the cultural divide with immigrant groups received passing mention in a trial over the Police Department’s stop-and-frisk practice.
abstract: New York City Police Academy training manual, Policing a Multicultural Society, describes various immigrant and ethnic groups that city's police officers will encounter; manual seeks to help recruits overcome cultural barriers that can escalate tense situations and stymie efforts to elicit information; little-known guide came to light recently during testimony in trial over Police Department's stop-and-frisk practices.
lead_paragraph: A manual designed to help officers bridge the cultural divide with immigrant groups received passing mention in a trial over the Police Department’s stop-and-frisk practice.

headline.main: Little-Known Guide Helps Police Navigate a Diverse City
headline.print_headline: Little-Known Guide (Definitely Not for Tourists) Helps Police in a Diverse City
